main.name: Mike Kang
main.occupation: Software Engineering Intern and CS student
main.bio: After co-founding a $1 million-funded startup (Nerdstudy), and working as a Product Manager (Quartermaster), I've returned to complete my B.Sc Computer Science at the University of Toronto, with the mission to pursue my passion: Technology. If you're looking for an intern in Software Engineering or Product Management, I'd love to get in touch with you!
main.randomFacts: My dog loves to lie down right beside me when I code. I call it pair-programming. As well, in the past I used to be a (roughly) Top 0.1% Starcraft 2 player, but nowadays I'm more interested in raising my 'programming eAPM.'
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Currently focusing on Javascript (Node.js, React) along with Sequelize.js ORM and MySQL. I am also working on getting more experience with Python as well!

work.title: Software Developer | Co-founder
work.description: Achieved 20k+ users and delivered more than 13 million lesson minutes. I coded the front+backend with LAMP stack and deployed it through Amazon EC2.

work.title: Product Manager
work.description: Launched web+mobile app into 50+ street communities, with over 3k Homeowners and 1k Businesses.

work.title: CEO | Co-founder
work.description: We raised $1 million in equity funding. We achieved an Average Session Duration of 9+ minutes, and achieved a Gross Sales (all-time) of $100k. I took on a Product role for a few years, and later switched into a Software role.

projects.title: Nerdstudy | Edu-tech, LMS
projects.category: My edu-tech startup, using Laravel, Vue.js, PHP, Apache, MySQL, and Stripe Integration

projects.title: Gingerale | Chat App
projects.category: Work-in-progress chat app with socket.io, node.js, react

projects.title: Merely | Product Board
projects.category: I got tired of spending money on Monday.com. So now I'm building a simple product board through MERN stack.

testimonials.text: I reference Mike Kang on a frequent enough basis in my daily work life that he has taken on somewhat mythical status among my teammates and peers. I had never before and have never since worked with someone who has such singular mission drive and such uncompromising standards for high quality in deliveries. Mike expects success to be a painfully earned process and he dedicates himself to the fine details of that process. He brings a work cadence and a clarity of purpose that makes the people around him better. He brings focused intensity and a palpable passion for accomplishment. He brings his full self (in popular usage: “full kang”) and that includes a dedication for outcomes that goes beyond the workplace. I think he would show up for any teammate at any time of need.
